intro: Mycaranthes tricuspidata, commonly known as the three-lobed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, milky sap and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three deep lobes, and the flowers are usually pink or purple. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
